theoryTitle: What If Luffy Had Awakened Gear 5 at Marineford?
theoryText: This theory explores an alternate timeline where Luffy discovers Gear 5 earlier and uses it at Marineford instead of awakening Conqueror's Haki. In this scenario, Luffy would have been powerful enough to defeat Admiral Akainu and successfully save Ace from execution.
evidence: Gear 5's reality-bending powers would theoretically surpass any admiral-level opponent
Luffy's awakening has been shown to grant him abilities far beyond his previous Gear forms
counterEvidence: Luffy needed to experience loss and train for two years to develop the strength required for later arcs
Ace's death was narratively necessary for Luffy's character development
Gear 5 awakening requires specific conditions that weren't present at Marineford

sources.title: Could One Piece Have Saved Ace? A Viral Theory Says Yes

theoryTitle: Ace's Death Was Necessary for Sabo's Memory Recovery
theoryText: This theory suggests that if Ace had survived Marineford, Sabo would never have recovered his lost memories of his sworn brothers. In canon, Sabo regained these memories only after seeing the newspaper headline announcing Ace's death. Therefore, Ace's death served a critical narrative purpose beyond just Luffy's development.
evidence: Sabo canonically regains his memories upon reading about Ace's death in the newspaper
The shock of Ace's death was stated to be the trigger for Sabo's memory recovery
Without this traumatic event, there's no clear narrative mechanism for Sabo to remember his past
counterEvidence: There could have been other ways for Sabo to recover his memories
The Revolutionary Army might have eventually helped Sabo recover his memories through other means

theoryTitle: Ace Could Return as a Spirit Guide Through Brook's Powers
theoryText: This fan theory proposes that Brook's Yomi Yomi no Mi devil fruit could potentially allow Ace to return as a spiritual entity rather than being fully resurrected. In this theory, Ace would serve as a spirit guide to Luffy during important crisis moments, witnessing Luffy's journey to become Pirate King from beyond death.
evidence: Brook's Yomi Yomi no Mi grants abilities related to souls and the afterlife
Brook himself returned from death through his devil fruit power
This would allow Ace's character to have continued significance without undermining his death
counterEvidence: Brook's fruit only worked because he ate it before dying; it cannot revive others
Bringing Ace back in any form would undermine the emotional impact and narrative weight of his death
There is no canonical evidence that Brook's powers can affect souls other than his own
Oda has stated that consequences matter in One Piece, making resurrection unlikely

sources.title: Can Ace Come Back To Life In One Piece? No - Here's Why

theoryTitle: Ace's Death Motivated Luffy's Two-Year Training
theoryText: According to fan analysis and discussion, 89% of One Piece fans believe that Ace's death was the primary motivating factor for Luffy's decision to undergo two years of intense training with Rayleigh. Without experiencing this devastating loss, Luffy might not have realized how unprepared he was for the New World and the true dangers of the Grand Line.
evidence: Luffy was devastated by his inability to save Ace despite his best efforts
The loss demonstrated that Luffy's current strength was insufficient for the New World
Rayleigh specifically pointed out that Luffy needed to become stronger
The time skip training arc directly followed Ace's death and Luffy's emotional breakdown
counterEvidence: Luffy had already faced numerous challenges that suggested he needed more training
The encounter with Kizaru at Sabaody Archipelago already showed Luffy he wasn't ready for the New World

theoryTitle: Why Garp Didn't Save Ace - God Valley Connection
theoryText: This theory suggests that Garp's failure to intervene in Ace's execution wasn't simply about 'following orders' but was connected to traumatic events Garp witnessed decades earlier at God Valley. The theory proposes that Garp's experiences there created a psychological barrier preventing him from acting, despite his love for Ace.
evidence: Garp's visible internal conflict during Marineford
Garp's complex relationship with Roger and his legacy
Garp positioned himself as a symbolic barrier but didn't use his full strength
Recent God Valley revelations add context to Garp's psychological state
counterEvidence: Garp did allow Luffy to pass by not fighting at full strength
Garp's loyalty to the Marines was established as a core character trait
The manga explicitly shows Garp's duty to the Marines outweighing his personal feelings
